RelatedSentence: The pace of U.S. beef and pork exports increased sharply in March , driven by double - digit increases to leading markets in Mexico , the China / Hong Kong region and South Korea , according to statistics released by the USDA and compiled by the U.S. Meat Export Federation ( USMEF ) .
U.S. pork exports reached their highest monthly total since October 2012 : 209,704 metric tons ( mt ) valued at $ 606.7 million , increasing 29 percent in both volume and value over March 2013 .
When measured in proportion to overall U.S. beef and pork production , March exports also showed gains .
Beef exports accounted for 14 percent of total production and 11 percent of muscle cuts , up from 12 and 9 percent in 2013 .
Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus ( PEDv ) has been a factor both in the U.S. and in a number of export markets , creating supply concerns going into the summer .
U.S. lamb exports dipped across the board in March , reaching 740 mt ( down 41 percent ) valued at $ 1.9 million ( down 37 percent ) .
Editor 's notes : Export statistics refer to both muscle cuts and variety meat unless otherwise noted .
